class pyTravHarv.TargetStore.MemoryTargetStore(target_store)

Bases: TargetStoreAccess

A class to represent a target store to harvest from. The given target_store string is a pointer to a triple store in memory.

class pyTravHarv.TargetStore.TargetStore(target_store=<class 'str'>)

Bases: object

A class to represent a target store to harvest from. The given target_store string is either a URI or a pointer to a triple store in memory.

execute()

Execute a SPARQL query on the target store

pyTravHarv.TravHarvConfigBuilder module

class pyTravHarv.TravHarvConfigBuilder.AssertPath(assert_path=<class 'str'>)

Bases: object

A path to assert. This class contains the following: - Path_parts: a list of strings - max_size: a function to return the len of the list of path_parts - get_path_for_depth(): a function that returns a path at a given depth

get_max_size()

Get the max size

get_path_for_depth(depth)

Get a concatination of the path parts up to a given depth

get_path_parts()

Get the path parts

Bases: object

Bases: object

A subject definition. This can be either a LiteralSubjectDefinition or a SPARQLSubjectDefinition depending on the type of subjects

class pyTravHarv.TravHarvConfigBuilder.TravHarvConfigBuilder(configFolder: str = None)

Bases: object

Builds a configuration object from a given config folder. If no folder is given, the current working directory is used as the config folder.

build_from_config(config_file_name)

Build a config object from a given config_file_name

build_from_dict(config_dict)

Build a config object from a given config_dict. The config_dict should be a dictionary with the following keys: - config_file_name: a dictionary with the following keys:

  • prefix: a dictionary with prefixes

  • assert: a list of asserts

    • subjects: a list of subjects or a SPARQL query

    • paths: a list of paths

example: {

“config_file_name”: {
“prefix”: {

“ex”: “http://example.org/”, “rdf”: “http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#”,

}, “assert”: [

{
“subjects”: {

“literal”: [”http://example.org/subject1”, “http://example.org/subject2”]

}, “paths”: [“/rdf:type”, “/ex:property”]

}

]

}

}

build_from_folder()

Build a config object from the folder given, all yml files in the folder will be used

class pyTravHarv.TravHarvConfigBuilder.TravHarvTask(task)

Bases: object

A task for the travharv This task contains the following: - SubjectDefinition class: a class that defines the subjects to be harvested - AssertPathSet class: a class that defines the paths to be asserted

get_task()

Get the task

pyTravHarv.TravHarvExecuter module

class pyTravHarv.TravHarvExecuter.TravHarvExecutor(config_filename: str, prefix_set: PrefixSet, tasks: list, target_store: TargetStore)

Bases: object

A class to represent a TravHarvExecutor. This class will assert all paths for all subjects given for each task per config.

assert_all_paths()

Assert all paths for all subjects given for each task per config.
